data.text: Absolutely love this place, my favourite pub around these parts. We parked ourselves down after a nice afternoon walk round the woods, next to a fire in a little nook and ate and gorged ourselves silly well into the evening. What more do you need from a cosy country pub! :)

data.text: Beautiful atmosphere and food,

data.text:
Book. Book. Book.

You'll likely be disappointed if you don't. This place books out quickly and unsurprisingly so.

The people are welcoming and friendly, the service is great and the food is wonderful.

We all had various Sunday roasts and all were done exactly how you'd want them to be. Generous portions too.

Add the open fire and it makes a lovely Sunday lunch experience.

Highly recommended.

Just remember to book.
data.name: Indeedfox

data.text: Only ever visited for drinks while visiting the nearby Quarry Bank Mill, but staff have always been friendly, drinks good and nice atmosphere.

data.text: I was at my sister in laws funeral yesterday the food was great the service was superb the staff couldn't do more for you excellent all round

data.text: Excellent food and a lovely attentive staff, but if your car is clean and it's raining the car park is like a ww1 battlefield, full of deep holes and muddy, you'd think they could do a little better.

data.text:
Overall i would say that my experience of the pub is that the food was very nice , tradional pub food with a bit of a twist . The Pub in the inside is very cosy in spots . I am giving 4 stars because one of the members of staff who served my friend and i was rather rude , We were booked in and the guy said "hurry up with the order we are busy" ... the booking told us about the 2 hour window  we already know there is an allotted time , the person serving us just generally came off like he mentally clocked out for the weekend and did not want to be there .

I would still reccomend visiting for the food and the walk in the woods nearby.

data.text: Great venue and food of good quality. Had to wait for desserts and they cane one by one. In the end two of us did not get a dessert. Waitress was lovely, not her fault.

data.text: A few years ago this was a brilliant place to eat quality proper home cooked style food and Sunday roasts. Was always rammed on a Saturday and Sunday. Now, it seems to have been incorporated into a chain of pubs and the quality of food is average but has retained the higher end "legacy pricing structure". For example, Â£17.95 for an average burger and chips. This was once a place to go out of your way for, now it's just passable food in a better than average setting/pub. The service was fine and staff perfectly pleasant.
data.name: Sirk Yiller

data.text: Good food, a little bit slow but good service. Chili cauliflower was fine. Fish and chips was a good portion and it was filling. Beer selection was a little bit touch and go.

data.text:
Long waiting time, a lot of other people arriving and ordering a long time after us were served way before our food arrived.
Had the steak and ale pie. Wasn't for me. Strange herb or spice crumbled onto the pastry.
Kids meals seemed to have equivalent portions.
Sunday roast seemed like pre packaged potatoes and mixed greens was just a handful of cabbage.
Eaten there in the past and food has been great. Just think I had a one off bad experience.

data.text:
The kitchen really lets this place down.

We came for a Sunday roast today. We had a starter (calamari), main (beef) and desert (sticky toffee pudding).

We arrived and were immediately pleasantly surprised by how attentive the service was. The table staff came straight to our table and took orders for drinks. We ordered the calamari and chipolatas  for our starter and it was very good. A great start.

It was all downhill from there. The roast was made up of a slither of fatty beef, a pile of tasteless mash, 3 tiny roasties that were so soggy they may as well have been even more mash, another pile of mashed swede (yes there was a theme to the plate) and some average greens. The texture of this meal could be summed up in one word - Mushy. Honestly the worst roast Iâ€™ve ever had at a restaurant.

For dessert we had sticky toffee pudding. There was no toffee and nothing sticky about it . It was just a dry square of something that may once have been a pudding.

Also - for the bar staff, please note, when someone orders a shandy, you shouldnâ€™t charge them for a full pint AND a â€œdash of lemonadeâ€ at an additional Â£1.10. Shandy is not supposed to be more expensive than a pint of lager

The service was great from table staff and the environment was nice enough but otherwise awful

What a let down.
data.name: Ashley â€œAshâ€ Lunn

data.text: After a long lunchtime walk I took a friend for lunch.  Not booked, sadly my MR sirloin steak at Â£29. Arrived dry, OVER COOKED AND buried under a pile of tomatoes,  mushrooms and spring greens. Very aware it was in hiding. On finding it I was shocked and disappointed.  It should be the main event on the PLATE. On telling the staff they did nothing ðŸ˜œ. I went home and the next evening cooked a tone steak MR and it only cost Â£8. Eating out is a disgusting shame 2023.
data.name: Tanya Rostron

data.text: Nice place to eat very delicious food in a quiet atmosphere. We ordered Fish and chips and a Beef burger. Fish and chips were big meal to eat. Loved the fish and first time tried some vinegar on my potato which was new but delicious. The burger was definitely the best burger I ever had.

data.text: We went for Sunday lunch in June. Whilst very busy (you can only book if you have a party of 6 or more), we were seated within 20 minutes. Theres a great selection of beers, ales, spirits. The Sunday menu is diverse, with a wide selection or roasts to choose from. We had the Lamb to share - it was so tender that it fell off the bone. Great selection of vegetables and plenty of gravy. Well recommended. We will be back again certainly.

data.responseFromOwnerText: Hi there Eddie, thank you, this is great feedback. We in fact celebrate this traditional culture at our pub, yet limited bar space and pre table bookings on a Sunday does make it difficult to champion during very busy times. However, your valued feedback has been shared with the team who will look into seeing if we can make any necessary adjustments to our Sundays. Many thanks and have a great week ahead. Jenny

data.text:
SUPERBLY WONDERFUL AND SENSITIVE SERVICE

On 17/8/22, I ate lunch at the Ship Inn with my nephew who has some special dietary needs.
All of the staff whom we dealt with, including the lead waitress, were FANTASTIC in discussing the menu with him, and were beautifully patient and sensitive in their approach.

JAMES was absolutely marvellous, making my nephew a dish which wasn't on the formal menu and which was exactly what he wanted.

What an EXCELLENT pub/restaurant the Ship Inn is. You always get a warm, friendly and professional welcome. My meal was delicious as well, but the CUSTOMER CARE on this visit was EXCEPTIONAL.

THANK YOU TO EVERYONE WHO WORKS THERE X

Joe P

data.responseFromOwnerText:
Hello Karen,

Apologies that you feel that we are not dog friendly. Unfortunately due to the size of our pub, and the volume of dogs that we have visit us on a daily basis (due to being next to a national park), we just canâ€™t welcome all of them inside due to hygiene and safety reasons.

We do our best to accommodate families with dogs by offering heated outside areas and doggie biscuits on tap, sorry we canâ€™t do more.

It does stipulate on the website where your dogs are welcome.

Many thanks

Jenny

data.text: Very impressed with the price and quality of the slow roast shoulder of lamb. The service too was good. When I asked if I could have more roast potatoes than boiled I was told I could have all roast.  I would recommend to the chef that he roasts the lamb in loads of bay leaves and/ or rosemary. By doing that you get a lot more depth of flavour. It can also enhance the flavour of the gravy. If I was the owner of the Ship I woul grow my own herbs outside the pub. Woody herbs like that can look nice and last all year round. One other thing is the person who brought out the Lamb did not tell us the serving dish was too hot to touch. Would recommend to staff that they remember to tell people. Anyway thanks to all for a very enjoyable lunch!

data.text: We went to the Ship last Friday afternoon. I had booked a table and checked that there was suitable disabled access. I was told to park on the car park and look for a door marked Private. No Access. Getting across the car park was a nightmare as the potholes are craters, in fact I got stuck and had to reverse out of a hole as I couldn't go forward. I located the  door but when I opened it the first thing I saw was a massive deep hole in the ground. There was not room to push a wheelchair past it so this entrance was a no no. We went round to the front of the building and I tried to push the wheelchair through the paved area up to the front door. I was having so much trouble that two young' well built guys got up from their table and came to help me. They were having trouble so a third customer came to help.The 3 of them managed it but you can imagine how difficult it was to take 3 strong men to access the building. I found a waiter and told him we had booked a table on the patio. He said we would not be able to get out at the back because of steps. Fortunately my husband can walk a few steps and there was a handrail so he was able to get down them and I carried the wheelchair down.After we had finished eating I went to look for the toilets. There is no disabled toilet and the facilities are all up a steep flight of stairs which I found difficult and quite scary. Leaving the premises we decided the best bet was to attempt to get out at the rear by going up to the hole in the ground then my husband would stand up and hold onto the wall. I would then take the wheelchair back down the passageway, up the steps,through the pub and outside across the front,round the back, across the car park and pick him up by the hole. As we were starting this the waiter appeared and came down the passageway with us. He held onto my husband and manoevered him past the hole so I could get the wheelchair past him and pick him up again.The waiter was as helpful as he could be but I should not have been told that the premises are suitable for disabled so if you have any disability don"t visit this pub. It was closed for refurbishment about 7 years ago but clearly does not conform to present regulations.

We waited over an hour for three starters, and when we complained, the manager was far from helpful and did not seem to care, simply saying there was nothing she could do. She said social distancing was the reason for the delay, which if it was the case, should have been mentioned upon ordering. Rather, it seemed they had filled more tables than they could cope with and were struggling to keep up. Had we not had to pay upon ordering we would have left after the hour wait. When the food did arrive, it was underwhelming at best and unpleasant in parts. I could have cooked it better myself.  A great shame for what could be a lovely little pub.

The food, despite a current kitchen refurbishment leading to a reduced menu, was first class, had something for everyone, and was praised by all ten of us. The staff were very efficient and friendly. data.text: Been to the Ship many times but never for dinner on a Sunday. It was very busy we had booked a table it was ready for us but not set up with cutlery etc. Had to wait a while for our orders to be taken then when the waitress brought our food she didn't know if it was pork or turkey on the plate! We had to sort it out ourselves.  3 people at our table got their main course as the rest of us were finishing....not ideal. Trying to get a dessert menu was almost impossible! Having said all this the food was excellent but I do think they need more staff as having to wait so long for food is not acceptable.

data.text: Normally very high quality. Manager had a disgraceful attitude towards us as paying customers and even request we vacate our table before we had sat down (Which we had a half an hour wait for) at a specified time. The food on a turkey bap meal supposed contained 'traditional trimmings' - Which amounted to a pot of gravy and a couple of potatoes. The food caused multiple members of our party gastric distress. The staff acted rude to their own staff members, one young boy was basically running the entire front of house by himself, and none of the staff acted politely to him (saying please and thank you) until one of our party members complained under their breath. All in all that manager's attitude was truly shocking and disgraceful and how she expects to keep customers returning is a mystery to me. There are plenty of other excellent restaurants that are viable alternatives to this restaurant nearby.

data.text: Traditional, cosy pub. The staff were very friendly and efficient. We visited on a Saturday lunch time. The food was very good, but could have been better. The scotch egg starter was tasty and enormous! The chicken liver pate was very nice. The mains were equally generous, although they do smaller portions of many of the mains. My wife had the butternut squash tortellini, which she said was good, but not great. It wasn't packing much flavour (other than the pesto sauce), and was not very hot. I had a pork culet special. The pork was a little overcooked, but it was tasty.  The accompanying cauliflower cheese was fabulous. Overall, a decent feed but fell short on execution.

data.text: What a little gem! Went for a day out to Quarry bank, walking through the grounds towards Style village and found the The Ship Inn. We opted for the roast beef with trimmings, even in the heat, wow, one of the best pub meals I've ever had. data.text:
Dont take any notice of the reviews about the barmaid. We visited this pub on our way to Manchester airport on holiday. We wanted a good meal and a nice pint before we left. Having read the reviews previously we were worried but still decided to give it a go. Thank goodness we did the pub is excellent. Very good atmosphere with log fire excellent real ale. The food was excellent I had Coc au vin with dauphanoius potatoes really good. My friend had lamb shank which looked great and he loved. My wife had chicken and ham pie which looked home made and she said was lovely. The staff were very courteous and the bill was very reasonable. What more do you want
Highly recommended

data.text: Been several times to The Ship Inn since it has been refurbished and all I can say is FAB, FAB, FAB.  The food has been great value and scrumptious and the staff (especially Becky) bend over backwards to welcome you and ensure you are having a nice time. I eat out a lot but when asked where I want to go by my husband, the first words out of my mouth are "The Ship Inn".
data.name: Trina Bradley

data.text: who does that woman think she is? the barmaid/female manager was so rude, we left after just one pint. such a shame as it used to be such a nice pub
data.name: chris Smith

data.text:
Terrible Pub - shame because could be very special. Appallingly run, unbelievably rude, atrocious service. The Barmaid/ manager is the most unprofessional barmaid I've ever encountered, maybe she should get a job at the Women's prison over the road? I hope they go bust so someone with a modicum of customer care takes over.
We go on a weekly basis due to its convenient location but not going ever again after Saturday: we went at 5pm on Saturday 24th for a hard earned pint. After being ignored at the bar for a couple of minutes by the three people behind the bar, the aforementioned barmaid barked at me that they weren't serving for half an hour because they "had been busy". I think this is what she said, it was snarled in such a vicious and despicable way that the local stood next to me had to interpret. I've never seen such appalling "service" (if you can call it that as we were not actually served at all) ever in any customer service environment, ever. Goodbye Ship Inn, I can't see you staying open much longer at this rate.
Avoid!
data.name: Lewis Woolcock
